decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells to fill the graveyard with Arclight Phoenix, which can then be brought back to the battlefield to pressure the opponent. The deck also includes spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Treasure Cruise is used to refill the hand, while Temporal Trespass offers a powerful finisher. The inclusion of Picklock Prankster provides additional value by creating a Treasure token when a Phoenix is cast from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to be quick and aggressive, overwhelming the opponent with constant threats.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost, efficient spells and creatures to deal damage quickly to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Spikefield Hazard, the deck aims to apply pressure early and often. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand to keep the aggression going. Additionally, the inclusion of dual lands and a variety of land types ensures consistent mana base for the deck's aggressive strategy.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on sacrificing creatures for value by using cards like Witch's Oven, Mayhem Devil, and Cauldron Familiar. The deck also utilizes Scavenger's Talent to disrupt the opponent's game plan and generate card advantage. The key strategy revolves around creating a loop of sacrificing creatures to trigger abilities and deal damage, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push. The addition of powerful threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provides a consistent source of damage to pressure the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively reanimate Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard using spells like Consider, Fiery Impulse, and Treasure Cruise. Additionally, the deck utilizes card draw spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand to maintain consistency and find the necessary combo pieces. The inclusion of cards like Artist's Talent and Stormcarved Coast provide additional support and synergy to the overall strategy of the deck. Overall, the focus is on tempo and efficiency in order to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of powerful creatures and spells.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to dominate through creature removal, disruption, and graveyard manipulation. By using cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Liliana of the Veil, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building towards a powerful late game with cards like Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. With the ability to control the board through removal and hand disruption, this deck aims to outvalue opponents and secure victory through attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of creatures and burn spells. It relies on efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Sunspine Lynx, along with direct damage spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The deck also includes a mix of land cards like Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins to provide additional value and utility. Overall, the strategy is to constantly apply pressure and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to combine the Retraction Helix card with various other cards to create a powerful combo strategy. By leveraging cards like Stormchaser's Talent, Stock Up, and Thundertrap Trainer, players can control the board and disrupt their opponent's strategy. Utilizing Mox Jasper and Mox Amber for ramping, as well as cards like Sleight of Hand for card draw, this deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent. Otawara, Soaring City and Kitsa, Otterball Elite provide additional support for the combo strategy.
